div.l: I wille go crepen in by my felawe
And fonde the cradell with his hand anoone
By god thoght he all wrang I haue mysgone
My hede is toty of my swynkyng to nyght
That maketh me that I go noght a ryght
I wote wele by the cradell I haue mysse go
Here lyght the myller and his wyf also
And forth he goth on twenty deuell wey
Vn to the bedde there as the myller ley
He wende haue cropen by his felaw Iohn
And in by the myller in crepte anoone
And caught hym by the nekke ⁊and softe he spake
He seid þow Iohn þow swyneshede awake
For cristes soule and here a noble game
For by that lord that called is seynt Iame
As I haue thries in thes shorte nyght
Swyued the mellers doughter bolt vp ryght
While thow has as a coward ben agast
Ȝei fals harlot qᵈuod the myller hast
A fals traytour fals clerk qᵈuod he
Þow shalt be dede by goddes dignite
Who durst be so bolde to dysparage
My doughter is cōmmyn of suche lynage
And by the throte bolle he caught Alen̄
And he hent hym dispitously agayn
And on the nose he smote hym with his fyste
Doun̄ ranne the blody streme vpon his bryst
And in the floore with nose ⁊and mouth to broke
The wallow as doth two pygges in a poke
And vp thei gone and doıı̄un agayn anoon̄
Till that meller spurned at a stoon̄
And down̄ he fell bakward vppon̄ his wyfe
That wyst no thyng of this nyce stryfe
